page.title: 05The Coastguard
page.content: Port Isaac coastguard is paid from government taxes. They get Â£1.85 an hour.People phone 999 and are put through to Falmouth. Then Falmouth phone Mr.Castle,the local coastguard, and when they say "Immediate" it means a life saving call. Other ways of finding out if people are in danger is by the radio or flares. If 1 maroon is set off it means the cliff rescue team must go out, if 2 go off it means the life boat must go out and 3 means they both go out. On a cliff rescue the helicopter from Culdrose or Cavanah goes out, the lifeboat goes out, the ambulance and the cliff team all go out.If you are swimming or have fallen in and are in danger they swim out. There are 18 part time coastguards.The coastguard covers the beaches between Tintagel Head and the River Camel
